Research

Here is my CV.

In my thesis I study outer automorphism groups of finite free products of finite groups, . My favorite free products of finite groups are the free Coxeter groups .

Being outer automorphism groups of virtually-free groups, the are closely related to , the outer automorphism group of the free group of rank . But there are also some differences. For example, Gersten found a polynomially-growing free-by-cyclic group which is a “poison subgroup”: groups containing it, such as , cannot be groups. On the other hand, every polynomially-growing group is virtually . This leaves open the question of whether the might be groups.

    In preparation.

Upcoming Travel

This summer, I will attend Young Geometric Group Theory VIII, the IHES summer school Aspects of Geometric Group Theory, and the Wasatch Topology Conference.

In the fall I will speak at the SUNY Albany Algebra/Topology Seminar, and at an AMS Special Session on Effective and Quantitative Advances in Low Dimensional Topology and Geometric Group Theory.
